column1: Landscape Archaeology and Digital Heritage - MSc
column5: 3D methods of digitally documenting objects, sites, and landscapes offer significant potential to archaeology and heritage management. Digital data can be a way of archiving heritage (the need for this has been graphically illustrated by the loss of world heritage sites to conflict) and it is becoming the gold standard for commercial recording of sites and landscapes.Digital data can be used for a variety of purposes:
column7: Please see the university website for further information on fees for this course.
column9: 1 year Full Time, 2 years Part Time
